alert.note: Alert for Wind River Mountains East; Wind River Mountains West (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 12:10PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...Snow Continues Over the Southern End of the Wind River Mountains... This is a special weather statement from the National Weather Service office in Riverton. * WHAT...Snow, heavy at times. Gusty northeast wind around 20 to 25 mph. Accumulations will be minimal on major roadways, but snow may add an additional couple of inches to the higher elevations. * WHERE...Southern end of the Wind River Mountains. * WHEN...Now through 6 PM Tuesday * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow continues to fall over the southern half of the Wind River Mountains, and it could be heavy at times. Motorists driving over South Pass this afternoon should be cautious to rapidly changing road conditions and reduced visibilities. Backcountry travelers should be prepared for adverse conditions and the likelihood of deep wet snow.

area.areaDesc: Wind River Mountains East; Wind River Mountains West
